definition: reliable/secure/stable/firm
settled/steady/stable
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at

sentences.english: Mom, I rode my bike without falling off.
sentences.chinese: 媽媽，我可以穩穩當當地騎自行車了。

sentences.english: He was firmly seated among the highest boughs.
sentences.chinese: 他穩穩當當地坐在最高的樹枝中間。

sentences.english: The baby loves being tossed up and safely caught.
sentences.chinese: 這小嬰孩喜歡人家把他拋起來再穩穩當當地接住。

sentences.english: I’m resting comfortably now, thank you.
sentences.chinese: 我現在坐得很穩當，謝謝你。

sentences.english: Order my steps in thy word: and let not any iniquity have dominion over me.
sentences.chinese: 求你用你的話，使我腳步穩當，不許什麼罪孽轄制我。

sentences.english: Do not fear the helm, the boat secure.
sentences.chinese: 把舵的不慌，乘船的穩當。

sentences.english: Later, you dig a hole beneath the boulder and lift out a pair of Surefooted Boots.
sentences.chinese: 然後，你在那巨石下挖洞弄出了一雙穩當之靴。

sentences.english: Soft black material on outer surface for comfort and a firm grip.
sentences.chinese: 黑色柔軟外層，使用舒適，握持穩當。

sentences.english: Hardy and sure-footed animal smaller and with longer ears than the horse.
sentences.chinese: 強壯並邁步穩當的動物，比馬身體小而耳朵長。

sentences.english: True and false of concave and convex jagged, secure, has the feeling of qingfen elegance.
sentences.chinese: 凹凸參差，真假穩當，有清芬高雅之感。

sentences.english: This chick was born not long ago, and is not even able to walk steadily.
sentences.chinese: 這隻雞雛剛出生沒多久，走路還不穩當呢。

sentences.english: Knowledge derives from education and is a surer road to wisdom.
sentences.chinese: 知識源於教育，同時也是通往智能較穩當的一條路。

sentences.english: We were just bumming along nicely when the tyre burst.
sentences.chinese: 我們正穩穩當當驅車前進時，突然輪胎爆了。

definition: cultured and refined (idiom); gentle and cultivated
everything steady and stable (idiom); overcautious and unimaginary
lit. what the heart wishes, the hand accomplishes (idiom) skilled at the job/entirely in one's element/going smoothly and easily
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
to advance gradually and entrench oneself at every step/to consolidate at every step
extremely difficult/even more difficult
thick stems and broad leaves (idiom)/boorish/rough and ready/sloppy
to comprehend (new things) by analogy
calm/unruffled
flawless/immaculate/perfect
to expend a great deal of effort
lit. outside-flexible, inside-firm (idiom)/fig. velvet glove
to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)/to aim too high
dependable
arrogant and obstinate (idiom)/unyielding
flowing (of speech, writing)/fluent/smooth and easy
